RelatedSentence: Just over a week ago , Shazam updated the free version of its mobile apps for iOS and Android so that users in the UK ( and Germany , Mexico and Brazil , as it happens ) could now open and play tracks that have been identified and ' tagged ' by the app , in music streaming service Deezer .

Just over a week ago , Shazam updated the free version of its mobile apps for iOS and Android so that users in the UK ( and Germany , Mexico and Brazil , as it happens ) could now open and play tracks that have been identified and ' tagged ' by the app , in music streaming service Deezer .
In other words , in said countries , one service has been bumped by the other - a curious move for the UK where both Shazam and Spotify are wildly popular .

A0: this was at the expense of support for rival music streaming service Spotify
RelatedSentence: I ca n't believe it , a friend wrote to me upon discovering the change .

For him - and many others like him , judging by complaints on Twitter and Shazam 's own support forum - without the ability to quickly search for ' Shazam'ed ' tracks on Spotify , where he consumes most of his music , the app 's utility has been rendered nearly worthless .
To make matters worse , he had previously paid to upgrade his version of the Shazam app for unlimited tagging , a feature that has since become free if you do n't mind putting up with ads .

A1: support for rival music streaming service Spotify
RelatedSentence: Interestingly , Shazam Encore , the premium version of the app , appears to still feature support for Spotify .
You get what you pay for , you might well say .

A1: to support iTunes , Deezer and Rdio
RelatedSentence: The free version of the UK app has chosen to support iTunes , Deezer and Rdio when - based on mindshare and , most likely , user numbers too - Spotify is the larger of the two streaming service here in Blighty .

The free version of the UK app has chosen to support iTunes , Deezer and Rdio when - based on mindshare and , most likely , user numbers too - Spotify is the larger of the two streaming service here in Blighty .
What you are doing instead is not offering the by far most popular service ...
and pushing another , less known service instead , writes one disgruntled user on Shazam 's help forum .
So this is obviously a commercial decision , he speculates , advising others to switch to Shazam competitor Soundhound , which continues to support Spotify .

Make of that what you will , though - presuming the company has heeded the backlash - I would n't be too surprised to see Spotify support return to the UK Shazam app sometime in the not - too - distant future .
